citations.narrative:
* The Short-Haired Kennel, has excessively chewed wood along the bottom of the outside wall of the building. The dog
doors within this outside wall are chewed and scratched too. These chewed and scratched wood surfaces cannot be
properly cleaned and sanitized, therefore increasing the disease potential eight adult dogs. Also, this indicates the wood
surfaces are not be maintained on a regular basis.
For the reduction of disease hazards for the dogs, all surfaces must be repaired and replaced and maintained when worn
or soiled.
This is a (1st) Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by (6-June-2023, counted from 1st RL Inspection) or the
applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your
next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
End Section

narrative:
3.1(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
* The Short-Haired Kennel, has excessively chewed wood along the bottom of the outside wall of the building.  The dog 
doors within this outside wall are chewed and scratched too.  These chewed and scratched wood surfaces cannot be 
properly cleaned and sanitized, therefore increasing the disease potential eight adult dogs. Also, this indicates the wood 
surfaces are not be maintained on a regular basis. 
 
For the reduction of disease hazards for the dogs, all surfaces must be repaired and replaced and maintained when worn 
or soiled. 
 
This is a (1st) Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by (6-June-2023, counted from 1st RL Inspection) or the 
applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your 
next Re-License Inspection.

Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
End Section
